articles.author: Gram Slattery, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has paused all military aid to Ukraine following his clash with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy last week, a White House official said on Monday.
articles.title: Trump halts all U.S. military aid to Ukraine, White House official says

articles.author: David Lawder, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's new 25% tariffs on imports from Mexico and Canada took effect on Tuesday, along with a doubling of duties on Chinese goods to 20%, launching new trade conflicts with the top three U.S. trading partners.
articles.title: Trade wars erupt as Trump hits Canada, Mexico, China with steep tariffs

articles.author: James Pearson, Polina Nikolskaya, Anton Zverev, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Several senior Russian missile specialists have visited Iran over the past year as the Islamic Republic has deepened its defence cooperation with Moscow, a Reuters review of travel records and employment data indicates.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russian missile experts flew to Iran amid clashes with Israel

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli fire killed at least two people in Rafah and injured three others in Khan Younis in the south of Gaza, raising fear among Palestinians that the ceasefire could collapse altogether after Israel imposed a total blockade on the shattered enclave.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills two Palestinians in Gaza amid impasse over ceasefire

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio
articles.description: European leaders are planning visits to Vietnam in coming months to strengthen ties with the Southeast Asian nation, officials said, amid tensions with Washington that could impact their exports to the United States.
articles.title: Europe prepares charm offensive in Vietnam amid US trade risks

articles.author: Richa Naidu, Khalid Abdelaziz
articles.description: Gum arabic, a vital ingredient used in everything from Coca-Cola to M&M's sweets, is increasingly being trafficked from rebel-held areas of war-torn Sudan, traders and industry sources say, complicating Western companies' efforts to insulate their supply chains from the conflict.
articles.title: How a key ingredient in Coca-Cola, M&M's is smuggled from war-torn Sudan

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis rested well overnight, the Vatican said on Tuesday, after the 88-year-old pontiff suffered a setback a day earlier as he battles double pneumonia in hospital.
articles.title: Pope resting, back on ventilation, after respiratory problems

articles.author: Mushtaq Ali
articles.description: Overnight clashes between Pakistani and Afghan security forces at the main border crossing between the countries caused thousands of people to flee their homes but the situation had calmed down by Tuesday morning, residents and officials said.
articles.title: Pakistan-Afghanistan border clashes ease, thousands seek shelter

articles.author: Emma Farge, Nafisa Eltahir
articles.description: Children under five, including babies, are among victims of sexual violence in the war between Sudan's army and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF), according to findings shared on Tuesday by U.N. children's agency UNICEF.
articles.title: Infants as young as one raped in Sudan, UNICEF says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Arab leaders meet in Cairo with Egypt to present a plan for Gaza that would sideline Hamas and create interim bodies run by Arab, Muslim and Western states.
articles.title: Arab summit to focus on Egypt's alternative to Trump's 'Gaza Riviera'
